document_data.name: Raman bin Alurah
document_data.siblings: [[Anjar bin Alurah]], [[Omar bin Alurah]], [[Hannah bint Alurah]], [[Alurah bint Alurah]]
document_data.mainbody: Imam '''Raman bin Alurah''' was a [[moralist]] priest of [[Najm]] and a prince of [[Hiyal]] around [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}
document_data.Personality: Raman was thin and tall. His gift for elaborate planning made him one of the Sultana's most dangerous sons.
document_data.Activities: As Imam, Raman led the religious following of Najm in Hiyal. He also served as the official keeper of Najm's mosque in the city. As a devoted moralist, Raman had close ties with the [[Pantheist League]] who hoped to instill their beliefs in Hiyal.
document_data.Relationships: Though not the youngest child of [[Alurah bint Asrah]], he was her youngest son.
